org.jooby

Interface Renderer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    View.Engine
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    YassonRawRenderer, YassonRenderer 

    public interface Renderer
    Write a value into the HTTP response and apply a format, if need it. Renderers are executed in the order they were registered. The first renderer that write a response wins! There are two ways of registering a rendering: 
     {
   renderer((value, ctx)  -> {
     ...
   });
 }
    Or from inside a module: 
     {
   use((env, conf, binder)  -> {
     Multibinder.newSetBinder(binder, Renderer.class)
        .addBinding()
        .toInstance((value, ctx)  -> {
          ...
        }));
   });
 }
    Inside a Renderer you can do whatever you want. For example you can check for a specific type: 
       renderer((value, ctx)  -> {
     if (value instanceof MyObject) {
       ctx.send(value.toString());
     }
   });
    Or check for the Accept header: 
       renderer((value, ctx)  -> {
     if (ctx.accepts("json")) {
       ctx.send(toJson(value));
     }
   });
    API is simple and powerful!
    Since:
    0.6.0
    Author:
    edgar

      static interface  Renderer.Context
      Contains a few utility methods for doing the actual rendering and writing.

      • KEY

        static final com.google.inject.Key<Set<Renderer>> KEY

    • Method Detail

      • name

        default String name()
        Returns:
        Renderer's name.

      • render

        void render(Object value,
            Renderer.Context ctx)
     throws Exception
        Render the given value and write the response (if possible). If no response is written, the next renderer in the chain will be invoked.
        Parameters:
        value - Object to render.
        ctx - Rendering context.
        Throws:
        Exception - If rendering fails.

      • of

        static Renderer of(String name,
                   Renderer renderer)
        Renderer factory method.
        Parameters:
        name - Renderer's name.
        renderer - Renderer's function.
        Returns:
        A new renderer.
